p: β-Elemene, a monocyclic sesquiterpenoid polyalkene, is one of the major components in atractylis ( Atractylodes lancea (Thunb.) DC) EO (18.0%) [ 22], myrrh ( Commiphora myrrha (Nees) Engl.) EO (8.7%) [ 50], and katrafay ( Cedrelopsis grevei Baill. and Courchet) EO (3.0–6.0%) [ 22]. It is known for its strong anti-angiogenic effects through inhibiting VEGF expression and repressing VEGF-dependent tumor angiogenesis [ 194, 195, 196, 197, 198, 199]. Myrrh oil may be fetotoxic based on its β-elemene [ 174] and furanodiene [ 200] content and therefore, should be avoided during pregnancy.
